item.title: Linux Networking - Source IP address selection
item.description: Any network device, be it a transit router or a host, usually has multiple IP addresses assigned to its interfaces. One of the first things we learn as network engineers is how to determine which IP address is used for the locally-sourced traffic. However, the default scenario can be changed in a couple of different ways and this post is a brief documentation of the available options. The Default Scenario Whenever a local application decides to connect to a remote network endpoint, it creates a network socket, providing a minimal amount of details required to build and send a network packet.
